alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 11:48AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Including the following areas, Small streams and rivers draining the Talkeetna Mountains including Willow Creek, Little Susitna River, Montana Creek, Sheep Creek and the Kashwitna River. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 AM AKDT, 4 to 6 inches of rain have fallen in the Talkeetna Mountains since Sunday evening. Light rain is expected to continue to day with an additional 0.5 to 1 inch possible through tonight in the Talkeetna Mountains. Willow Creek, Little Susitna River and Moose Creek have all risen above minor flood stage overnight. Flooding of local roads has been reported near Willow Creek and the Little Susitna River. Roads that have been reported as closed or with water over them include West Shrock Road, Sitze Road, Moose Meadow Road and Shorty Drive near the Little Susitna River and numerous roads near Willow Creek reported as closed or overtopped including North Burrow Street and West River Air Drive near Willow Creek. Water levels on the Little Susitna River and Willow Creek are still rising slowly at the Parks Highway and are expected to crest this afternoon into this evening. Additional areas of minor flooding are possible today. The Kashwitna River, Talkeetna River and Susitna River have risen overnight to near bankfull conditions and have crested or are receding with no flooding expected along those rivers. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
